hanzi-su-wiki:
敷

Значения

Стелить, расстилать, мостить; выстилать, мощение, покрывать

Мнемоника

Раскладывать ветки 攵 так, чтобы они расходились во все стороны 方, как слава о великом вожде 甫, т.е. делать настил.
purpleculture_pinyin:
fū
to spread; to lay out; to apply (powder, ointment etc); sufficient (to cover); enough
распространять; выложить; нанести (пудра, мазь и т. д.); достаточный (чтобы покрыть); довольно
rtega_mnemonic:
敷敷RSspread, diffuse, apply, paint
  • hand working 攵 to spread news 旉
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 旉 indicates the sound; 攵 (tap) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
敷衍 [ fū yǎn ]: to elaborate (on a theme); to expound (the classics); perfunctory; to skimp; to botch; to do sth half-heartedly or just for show; barely enough to get by
敷衍了事 [ fū yǎn liǎo shì ]: to do things half-heartedly; to merely go through the motions
敷衍塞责 [ fū yǎn sè zé ]: to skimp on the job; to work half-heartedly; not to take the job seriously
入不敷出 [ rù bù fū chū ]: income does not cover expenditure; unable to make ends meet
敷设 [ fū shè ]: to lay; to spread out
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 旉 [ fū ] to announce, to state
    • 攵 [ pū ] to rap, to tap; script; to let go
heisig_chinese_memo: Arrowheads are spread all over the field. The taskmaster profiteerer forces you to apply yourself in finding them all using a compass.
heisig_constituent: spread, arrowhead, rice field, brains, compass, direction, taskmaster
heisig_story: At the top we have the arrowhead whose vertical line joins it to the rice field (or brains) below it. Beneath it, the compass; and to the right, the taskmaster.
koohiiStory1: Instead of being glued to one specialty (#46) 専, I decided to spread my attention in many directions 方, and be a taskmaster at none.
koohiiStory2: Arrowheads are spread all over the field. The taskmaster profiteerer forces you to find them all using a compass.
jp_example_words:
屋敷(やしき): mansion
座敷(ざしき): tatami room
敷地(しきち): site
敷く(しく): spread out, to lay out, take a position
風呂敷(ふろしき): wrapping cloth, cloth wrapper
WaniKani_Radicals: 十, 田, 方, 夂
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Taking a cross, you walk through the rice paddy in the direction of winter and spread your arms wide. You spread your arms to halt the approach of winter because your rice paddy is not done growing yet. You take the cross with you for some extra religious power of persuasion.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine facing the direction of the approaching winter while facing away from the rice paddy. Feel the weight of the cross in your hands as you spread your arms and implore the winter to hold off on its arrival.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
You’re actually a Sheikh (しき) (an Arab leader) which makes the fact that you’re holding a cross while you spread your arms even more of a big deal. You spread your arms wider than any Sheikh ever has before.
Side note: The official kun'yomi reading is just し but since no vocab words ever use し, we're teaching you しき, which includes what used to be okurigana but is never used outside of the kanji anymore.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel the strain on your Sheikh arms as you continue to spread them. Since you’re a Sheikh, you have to set a good example for your people, so don’t let them (or your arms) down.
Ru_Radicals: 丶 (капля), 十 (десять), 攵 (складной стул), 方 (сторона), 田 (рисовое поле)
Ru_trainchinese: fū: (глаг) применять, наносить (мазь и т.д.); удовлетворять
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the first time the way (旉) to strike (攵) is to spread out
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Arrowheads are spread all over the field. The taskmaster profiteerer forces you to apply yourself in finding them all using a compass.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "攴", "尃", the original meaning is to give and give. "Said Wen": "𢻱 also. From the 攴, 尃声. "The Book of the Week" says: Use 𢾭 for the descendants." "Confucius's Words and Thoughts": "Return to the wishes of the King of Ming, the master and the auxiliary, and apply it The five teachings are guided by etiquette and music."

" Apply " can mean spread and spread. "Shu‧Da Yumo": "The fate of literature is applied to the four seas, and it is only inherited by the emperor." Cai Chen's collection: "Since Yu has spread his culture and education in the four seas, Chen Qimo respected Shun."

" Apply " also means to spread out and expand. "Shu‧Gu Ming": "Surfing between the corners of the wall, laying heavy bamboo mats."

" Apply " also means separation and distinction. "Shu‧Yugong": "Yu spreads the soil, publishes the woods along with the mountains, and lays the mountains and rivers." Sun Xingyan quoted Ma Rong as saying: "Fit, divide."

" Apply " also refers to statement and narration. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long-Preface": "Selected essays in order to finalize the text, and apply the rationale to summarize the system.

" Apply " also refers to distribution and apportionment. Song Shenkuo's "Mengxi Bi Tan‧ Guanzheng I": "If you don't have its old name, you don't know it in the future, or you apply salt and koji, it will be repeated."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "攴", "尃", the original meaning is to give and give.
humanum_full_description:
從「攴」，「尃」聲，本義為給予、施予。《說文》：「𢻱也。从攴，尃聲。《周書》曰：用𢾭遺後人。」《孔子家語‧致思》：「回願得明王聖主輔相之，敷其五教，導之以禮樂。」

　　「敷」可表示傳布、散布。《書‧大禹謨》：「文命敷于四海，祗承于帝。」蔡沈集傳：「禹既已布其文教於四海矣，於是陳其謨以敬承于舜。」

　　「敷」也表示鋪開、擴展。《書‧顧命》：「牖間南向，敷重篾席。」

　　「敷」還表示分別、區分。《書‧禹貢》：「禹敷土，隨山刊木，奠高山大川。」孫星衍注引馬融曰：「敷，分也。」

　　「敷」也指陳述、鋪敘。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧序志》：「選文以定篇，敷理以舉統。」

　　「敷」還指分派、分攤。宋沈括《夢溪筆談‧官政一》：「若沒其舊名，異日不知，或再敷鹽麴，則致重複。」
humanum_short_description: 從「攴」，「尃」聲，本義為給予、施予。

"Confucius's Words and Thoughts": "Return to the wishes of the King of Ming, the master and the auxiliary, and apply it The five teachings are guided by etiquette and music." " Apply" can mean spread and spread. "Shu‧Da Yumo": "The fate of literature is applied to the four seas, and it is only inherited by the emperor." Cai Chen's collection: "Since Yu has spread his culture and education in the four seas, Chen Qimo respected Shun." " Apply" also means to spread out and expand. "Shu‧Gu Ming": "Surfing between the corners of the wall, laying heavy bamboo mats." " Apply" also means separation and distinction. "Shu‧Yugong": "Yu spreads the soil, publishes the woods along with the mountains, and lays the mountains and rivers." Sun Xingyan quoted Ma Rong as saying: "Fit, divide." " Apply" also refers to statement and narration. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long-Preface": "Selected essays in order to finalize the text, and apply the rationale to summarize the system. " Apply" also refers to distribution and apportionment. 敷字的基本解释

敷
fū
布置，铺开，摆开：敷设。敷陈（铺陈，详细叙述）。敷衍（ａ．叙述并发挥，亦作“敷演”；ｂ．做事不够负责或待人不恳切，只做表面上的应付；ｃ．勉强维持）。
涂上，搽上：敷药。敷粉。
足够：入不敷出。
古同“肤”，表面的。

敷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fū］
［《廣韻》芳無切，平虞，敷。］
亦作“旉1”。“傅2”的被通假字。“蓲3”的被通假字。“溥2”的被通假字。
(1)施予；施行。
(2)传布；散布。
(3)铺开；扩展。
(4)搽；涂。
(5)陈述；铺叙。
(6)分别；区分。
(7)分派；分摊。
(8)饶足；够。
(9)通“溥”。普遍。参见“敷天”、“敷求”。
(10)通“傅”。附着；连结。
(11)通“膚”。参见“敷淺”。
(12)姓。明有敷季雅。见《万姓统谱·平虞》。

敷字的英文翻译

◎ 敷
apply, be sufficient for, sprend

敷字的康熙字典解释

【卯集下】【攴字部】　敷； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页474第53
〔古文〕旉【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?芳無切，音罦。【五經文字】?，經典相承，隷省作敷。【書·舜典】敷奏以言。【傳】敷，?也。　又【書·大禹謨】文命敷于四海。【傳】言其外布文德敎命。又【臯陶謨】翕受敷施。【傳】以布施政敎。　又【詩·大雅】罔敷求先王。【箋】無廣索先王之道。　又【廣韻】散也。　又與傅同。【前漢·宣帝紀】傅奏其言。【註】師古曰：傅讀曰敷。

敷字的源字形

敷字的起名意思

意为施予，给予，也有涂，搽之义，还表示足，够。

apply
Basic explanation of words
apply
fū
Lay out, spread out, spread out: laying. Fu Chen (lay out, detailed description). Perfunctory (a. Narrate and play, also as a "perfume"; b. Do not be responsible enough or treat people not earnestly, only to deal with the surface; c. Reluctantly maintain).
Put on, put on: dressing. Apply powder.
Enough: make ends meet.
Ancient with "skin", superficial.
apply
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fū］
["Guangyun" Fang Wuqie, Pingyu, Fu. ]
Also known as "旉1". "Fu 2" was passed falsely. The false character of "蓲3" was passed. "Pu 2" was passed falsely.
(1) Give; implement.
(2) Spread; spread.
(3) Roll out; expand.
(4) Paint; paint.
(5) Statement; shop narration.
(6) Respectively; distinguish.
(7) Distribution; apportionment.
(8) Forgiveness; Enough.
(9) Through "Pu". universal. See "to apply to the sky", "to apply to the sky".
(10) Through "Fu". Attach; connect.
(11) Through "skin". See "Apply shallow".
(12) Last name. Ming has Fu Jiya. See "The Genealogy of Wan Xing·Pingyu".

apply, be sufficient for, sprend

apply
Source glyph
apply
Name meaning
It means to give and give, but also has the meaning of smearing and painting. It also means enough and enough.
敷

①铺开;摆开:~设|~席。②涂上;搽上:~药|~粉。3

применять

Цунчжи (женщина) означает распространение вручную; Цун 専, 専 - древнее слово для применения; 専 (кровь) также выражает звук.
Первоначальное значение - разложить.
Пристройка под покраску и покраску.

писец
"Кай
fū
гл.
1) распространять; расставлять; расстилать, раскидывать; развёртывать; рассыпать
敷于四海 распространять повсюду; распространяться по всей стране
星敷 рассыпаться, как звёзды на небе
2) втирать, натирать; размазывать; накладывать
用药敷之 натирать его (больное место) лекарством
敷油 натирать маслом
3) излагать, докладывать
敷文奏怀 изложить свои сокровенные мысли в докладе трону
4) хватать; быть достаточным; покрывать (напр. о доходах и расходах); достаточный; обильный
入不敷出 доходы не покрывают расходов
5) * делить, разграничивать; управлять
敷土 делить (разграничивать) землю; управлять землями
II собств.
Фу (фамилия)
Radicals: 十, 田, 方, 夂  (cross, rice-paddy, direction, winter)
Meaning Mnemonic
Taking a cross, you walk through the rice paddy in the direction of winter and spread your arms wide. You spread your arms to halt the approach of winter because your rice paddy is not done growing yet. You take the cross with you for some extra religious power of persuasion.
Imagine facing the direction of the approaching winter while facing away from the rice paddy. Feel the weight of the cross in your hands as you spread your arms and implore the winter to hold off on its arrival.
Reading Mnemonic
You’re actually a Sheikh (しき) (an Arab leader) which makes the fact that you’re holding a cross while you spread your arms even more of a big deal. You spread your arms wider than any Sheikh ever has before.
Side note: The official kun'yomi reading is just し but since no vocab words ever use し, we're teaching you しき, which includes what used to be okurigana but is never used outside of the kanji anymore.
Feel the strain on your Sheikh arms as you continue to spread them. Since you’re a Sheikh, you have to set a good example for your people, so don’t let them (or your arms) down.

Examples: 敷く (し.く)
丶 (капля), 十 (десять), 攵 (складной стул), 方 (сторона), 田 (рисовое поле)
